channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped mattress, 2nd August
item.description:
Please remove, thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westgate Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin on pellerin road outside 38, 2nd August
item.description:
There’s an overflowing bin outside 38 and a fox has got into it and strewn rubbish all over the pavement and street. Can this please be cleaned up asap?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littered Street, 2nd August
item.description:
The Wyndham Road is full of rubbish - the entire way down from Camberwell Rd to Walworth Rd. the area is revolting. Cars park and dump their rubbish. The areas around the school are grim and include nitrous oxide cans. Southwark needs to clamp down on litterers and start monitoring people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 140, Wyndham Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidbrooke Lane, Well Hall, London

item.title: Signs with unclear words, 2nd August
item.description:
See first photo. Someone thinks “clean up after your dog” means leave the bag of dog poo on the ground. Please think and be more explicit when wording signs. “Bag and bin dog poo - always”.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): York Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing shop bin fell on the road, 2nd August
item.description:
Litter bin of the village shop was again left overflowing on the street. It fell and spread all the litter around in the whole street. This is disgusting and a recurrent issue that hasn’t been solved. These commercial litter bins should be kept on premises not on the public street. Please could you handle this urgently before it spreads further and cause an accident? Kind regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Full and overflowing bin, 2nd August
item.description:
The dog waste bin at the top of Forty Foot Way going into the park has overflowed and there are bags piling up all over the ground underneath it now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avery Hill Road, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
